attributes.action: limit or prevent the inflated prices pubs charge for soft drinks
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It is unfair to charge the same price (in some pubs) for buying a pint of lemonade as a pint of lager.  I am not implying that lower prices would encourage people not to drink drive but it may encourage people to drink non-alcoholic beverages as well as their alcohol.

We are advised to have non-alcoholic drinks in between alcoholic drinks but when this will double the cost of a night out is the average drinker really going to follow this advice? 

How many of us have been thirsty at a bar but told we cannot have a glass of tap water without being charged for it - do we really have to drink from bathroom taps in order to control dehydration and avoid become too inebriated?

Soft drinks should have a controlled mark up limit in pubs so that we can all reduce the effects of binge drinking in the UK.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
